alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 15 at 9:22PM CDT until March 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, except 14 to 18 inches for the higher terrain of northern Iron and Ashland counties. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph causing blowing and drifting of the snow. * WHERE...Ashland and Iron Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bad River Reservation and the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band. * WHEN...From 1 PM Thursday to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
